Transcription-Unit.comment: Transcription of the genes fimA, fimB, and fimE appears to be indirectly repressed by the protein GadE under low pH. The proteins GadW and GadX and also CRP seem to regulate the three fim genes, but it has not been determined if this regulation is direct [Schwan22]. During stationary phase, RpoS causes a negative effect on transcription of the fimA and fimB genes but not fimE [Schwan22].

Evidence-Code.comment: The length of the (transcribed) RNA is experimentally determined. The length of the mRNA is compared with that of the DNA sequence and by this means the number of genes transcribed are established.

Promoter.comment:
Baljinder et al. showed that NanR, NagC, and IHF activate fimB gene expression, but they could not determine which of the three promoters (fimBp1, fimBp2, or fimBp3) is affected [Sohanpal07, Sohanpal04], and none could demonstrate which is the transcription activation mechanism. They concluded that the activation from NagC and IHF could be indirect, altering the DNA structure of the intergenic region between fimB and nanC. Another possibility of activating the system is through direct contact of NagC with RNA polymerase [Sohanpal07, Sohanpal04].

There are three potential transcription start sites. Transcription starting from two of the sites (P1 and P2) would produce an mRNA that approximates the transcript size of fimB previously detected by Northern blot hybridizations.

On the other hand, a σ32-dependent promoter was suggested to be located upstream of fimB [Wade06], but it is unknown whether this promoter is the same as fimBp2 .

Evidence-Code.comment: The transcription start site is identified by primer extension.
